messages.subject: learn to play chess
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/17/03 11:07:59 AM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/17/03 11:07:59 AM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< My DS is asking for a chess set for his 4th b-day next month and I'd
like to learn to play along with him. Anyone have any links, books,
or other recommendations for beginners? >>

I highly recommend the book "Learn chess in a weekend" by Ken Whyld.
It's got a lot of pictures and bits and pieces of information that make the
basics very understandable. It covers a lot of information.

Watch "Searching for Bobby Fischer" together, great movie.
And the guy that the movie is about, Josh Waitzkin, has his own chess books
out (he's all grown up now). Good start anyway.

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett
